ygData.msgSnippet: Arief, ... In the file I sent you, I prefaced the species entry with gri30: , and also the reactions entry.  This means that Cantera will look for these

Subject: Re: [cantera] Re: question about flame1
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Arief,

> (1) why are there no thermodynamic and reaction
> data in it, as in the case of h2o2.xml?

In the file I sent you, I prefaced the species entry with "gri30: ", 
and also the reactions entry.  This means that Cantera will look for 
these species / reactions in file gri30.xml, instead of in the local 
file.  The gri30.xml file comes with Cantera.

> (2) what is the role of the file h2o2.xml? Is
> it an output file, or is it being used during the
> flame calculations?

When Cantera reads a .cti input file, it first converts it to another 
format and gives it the extension .xml.  The xml file is then read to 
build the objects used in the application program.  You can regard the 
.xml file as an internal intermediate file that you don't have to worry 
about.  Alternatively, once you have created the xml file, you can use 
it in place of the cti file in your program.  This is useful if you 
want to run Cantera on a machine that does not have Python installed, 
since Python is required to do the cti -> xml conversion but not to 
read the xml file.

> (3) I modified the file h2o2.cti, such that it contains
> ideal_gas(name = "ohmech",
>       elements = " O  H  Ar  N ",
>       species = """ H2  H  O  O2  OH  H2O  HO2  H2O2  AR  N2 """,
>       reactions = "all",
>       transport = "Mix",
>       initial_state = state(temperature = 300.0,
>       pressure = OneAtm)    ).
> However, when I perform the flame calculation I get
> the error message species "N2" unknown. Why do I get
> this error mesage?
>
Because it is looking for a definition of species "N2" in the local 
file, but not finding one.

> PS. To replace AR by N2 I redefined AR in the .cti file,
> such that it contains 2 nitrogen atoms and accompanying
> physical data. This seems to work.
That works. Or you can just add a species entry for N2 in addition to 
AR.
>
>
Dave
